column4: hey i am having a problem... i installed ubuntu on my external HD and when i boot i get error 21, i tried doing the root and setup thru sudo grub and no prevail can someone help me?
it cannot access the configuration file. Check if your partition is o.k. If it is, use the same procedure as to recover mbr after windows installation.
and check if the config file contains proper writeups.
how can i check the parition is okay, i know how to do fixmbr to get back into windows but i wanna get this working
the instruction as to when windows installation overwrites mbr. It will tell you how to reinstall grub. Using live cd you can check the partitions and files on them.
im using live cd now, sorry im a noob at this, how can i check the partitions and files are on them
http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/reinstall-ubuntu-grub-bootloader-after-windows-wipes-it-out/ <- instructions.
it says root (hd0,0) but i installed ubuntu on external hd, but did it install grub there ?
and here is the problem.
did you follow any instructions how to do it properly?
what'd ya mean? i followed the instructions from that link before
when i tried root (hd0,0) and then setup (hd0) it says error 17
it's not hd0,0 in your case. http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/09/28/usb-ubuntu-710-gutsy-gibbon-install/
it says to set USB as boot device in BIOS (my bios only has 3 options.... HD/network/cd
invest in lilo then, and you will have to alter the hd a little bit.
sorry, not hd. kernel.
also following that tutorial it says umount /dev/sdx1 when i do that for mine which is sdb6 it says 'command not found'
umount not found?
root@ubuntu:/home/ubuntu# unmount /dev/sdb6
not unmount, but umount
sorry im retarded
happens to the best (yea, right)
gnome-screensaver-command -a
system -> preferences -> keyboard shortcuts (an easy way)
